result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert E. Cebery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
NO CONTACT WITH METH USERS/DEALERS
NO POSSESSION OF PARAPHERNALIA
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

timeConds.notes:
Granted credit for time served.
To contact the Ashland County Jail within 10 days to set up time to begin serving sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Atty Snyder/Judge's Order to amend JOC
Notice of Requirements and Penalties under 941.29 and 941.291

Defendant Robert E. Cebery in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have no requests to change factual underpinning of PSI. DA comments disagrees with recommendation of PSI for no jail time. Feels probation appropriate,requests jail time 6-8mo, remaining rec of DOC are appropriate. AODA, no MAS, not present, UA, NC with Meth users/dealers, DNA, fin obligations. Atty Snyder agrees with the recommendations of the PSI author, argues against addition jail time.
Ct orders  Sent WH prob 2yrs 90days conditional jail time. 3 days time served requested by Atty Snyder. Ct gives 1 day TS, defense can provide documentation of more....report to DOC 24 hrs. 10days contact jail begin no later 5/15 9am. Absol, Rx only as pres, AODA, treatment as deemed appropriate, NC with Meth users/sellers, No para, other counseling, DNA, No gun no vote. $200 fine=$938.70 contraband forfeited. DA requests cost for buy money $200. Atty Snyder denies that, $80 was all the def received. DA comments, Ct request for hearing? Atty Snyder does not. $200 added to costs. $40 per month beginning 5/19  Days to pay scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Robert E. Cebery in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder by phone.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling to replace 4/14 sentencing. 4/19 3:15pm  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
